metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0404 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In uvc_scan_chain_forward of uvc_driver.c, there is a possible linked listcorruption due to an unusual root cause. This could lead to localescalation of privilege in the kernel with no additional executionprivileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product:AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-111893654References: Upstreamkernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-177.207
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-96.97~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-96.97~16.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-177.207').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-96.97~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1069.76').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1105.116').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1065.69~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1077.82').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1060.64').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.41~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1131.140').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.143').
